comment: Expect a lot of time spent on making PowerPoints, projects, discussions, and various replies. Expect the grading rubrics to be extremely wordy to the point a lot of the class makes mistakes, and the teacher will penalize said students instead of looking how their rubrics are organized. Expect a 0% if you make 1 or 2 mistakes on an assignment.

The class was pretty much making art projects and doing discussion posts. The class itself kind of sucks but Prof. Phillips isn't bad. He clearly likes what he's doing and is really polite. He also emails back fast. Seems like a chill guy.

He obviously really cares about his students. Don't take his class if you don't plan on putting in the effort. He gives a lot of homework but I honestly feel that I improved when I took his class. He is very good at giving helpful critiques and lets you resubmit reworked pieces for a better grade.

I had this professor for ART 2990 which isn't listed as an option on RMP. He was amazing at answering emails fast and graded fairly from my experience. The class is just generally really easy apart from a group project which was annoying to do in an online class.

Prof. Phillips was my most difficult professor at Kennesaw University so far. He did not provide our class with a clear rubric for assignments/projects. He was unfiltered and relentless in his feedback about students' work, so you have to be mentally tough to succeed. He will push you to improve as an artist, but you often have to teach yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He is tough and gives lots of homework, but as long as you attend his classes and turn in assignments on time you should be fine. He did give us till the end of the semester to redo our work to recieve a better grade which is a plus. This was one of my harder classes but I do feel I have learned new skills in my art ability.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: He is a great guy, but DONT TAKE HIS CLASS. He gave me more homework in this class than in any of my other classes. Even in my core classes like math, English, history, and literally any of my other classes, TOO MUCH HOMEWORK. I learned alot in person coming to class, and I really like him personally, but learned nothing from all the homework.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: He can be considered tough to many people but if you do your work and are accountable for your assignments then hes awesome. He gives amazing feedback, I will say his grading is a little harsh but its usually true. He allows you to redo assignments to get a higher grade in the class as well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This was my hardest class. So much homework. I asked him if his teachers were hard on him when he was in college, and he said no that he was hard on himself and spent hours working on his art projects, and now he EXPECTS his students to do so also. He cares a lot and gets to know you as a person and artist. If you work hard he is great.

I love Professor Phillips, but I won't go as far to say that he's my absolute favorite. It can be hard to tell if he's joking or not and he seems to get angry VERY quickly with no warning. Other than that, he gives fantastic feedback on graded assignments and is normally very understanding. He encourages returning in assignments to see improvement.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Truly one of the best professors I've ever had. He really focuses on each student individually and gets to know you as an artist. He really understands the technical aspects and can help you a lot with the construction of your sculpture, but also gives you totally new ways to think about your art. You get a lot of freedom to create what you want.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: This class is strange, its almost as though you have to explain your butt off for why you chose everything that you did for your sculpture to get an A. Hes not a bad teacher, and I like that he gets to know each and everyone of his students. Dont get on his bad side cause he really likes to snap at people. Taught me new ways to think about art
